They Just Don T Get It

25 Oct 2000

Someone in my company recently asked me for help\nwith a Javascript error she was getting. "Sure," I said, \nbeing an old programmer who loves a challenge. The problem\nwas on a very well-known Canadian corporation's Web site, \nwhich several people inside our company use on a regular basis, and \nwho knows how many thousands in the real world. It was happening in \nNetscape but not Internet Explorer.

\n

Here's the code that was generating the error --

\n

\n   <input type="text" name="origin" size="10" value="">\n
  <img src="/images/nav/home/down_arrow.gif"\n
    width="16" height="22" align="absmiddle"\n
    alt="Choose a City" border="0"\n
    onMouseDown="setMouseDown(event, self);"\n
    onMouseUp="openWindow(event, self,\n
     'schedules/scheduling/cityOptions.html',\n
     'newWindow__schedule_origin__schedule_org',\n
     390, 140);">\n

\n

"Wow," I opined. "That is so cool!"  \n"Shaddap, Rudy. You're talking out loud again," \ncame a voice from over the cubicle partition.\n

This was the first time I had ever seen anything like this. \nIt's a combination INPUT TEXT field and a\nspecial "down arrow" gif, and together they look just like a dropdown select list.\nWhen you click on the image that looks like the down arrow of\na dropdown list, a small window pops up which contains --\nare you ready for this? -- a dropdown list! You pick an entry from the list, \nand it gets populated back into the text box. \n(How do I know this? Because it works fine in Internet Explorer. However,\nNetscape is our company standard.) You have to close the popup window \nusing the Close button, but that's a minor quibble. Alternatively, if you know\nwhat you want, you can type it right into the text box. Not a bad idea, \na combination input/dropdown control. Too bad it throws an error\nin Netscape, eh? \n

"Okay, I'll get to the bottom of this," I said -- to myself, this time.\nThere's a Contact page, I'll write to the webmaster.

\n

Here's what transpired.\nNote that I've changed the domain to foobar.ca because\nthey did not give me permission to post their emails and make fun of them on \na public site, although I daresay they probably would never know it.\n

\n\n\n

2000-10-03 15:47\n
  hi webmaster\n
  several people in our company are reporting javascript errors using your home page\n
  "JavaScript Error: http://www.foobar.ca/home.html, line 705: init is not defined."\n
  plus a couple others (possibly related)\n
  seems to be only certain versions of netscape (not sure)\n
  internet explorer 4.01 works okay\n
  rudy limeback

It was ten (10) days before the answer came back:

\n\n\n

2000-10-13 10:13\n
 Hello,\n
  that will occur with older browsers.\n
  Our website is compatible with versions of 4 +\n
  regards,\n
  webmaster@foobar.ca

Duh. No it's not.

\n\n\n

2000-10-13 11:25\n
  thanks for the reply\n
  the javascript errors are occuring on netscape 4.04 specifically (our company desktop standard) and other 4+ versions of netscape\n
  there must be something wrong with your netscape 4+ version detection script, because i'm still getting these errors --\n
  JavaScript Error: http://foobar.ca/home.html, line 913: IsBrowser is not defined.\n
  JavaScript Error: http://foobar.ca/home.html, line 713: init is not defined.\n
  JavaScript Error: http://foobar.ca/home.html, line 625: function does not always return a value.\n
    }\n
  ..^\n
  just thought you should know\n
  rudy

Only four days to get an answer this time (two if you don't count the weekend):

\n\n\n

2000-10-17 11:04\n
 Hello,\n
  You will need the latest version, Netscape 4.75. 4.04 is an older\n version. You need only upgrade the browser version.\n
  regards,\n
  webmaster@foobar.ca

I don't believe it. Let's see if I can get this person on the phone.\nNotice that he or she has still not identified himself/herself.

\n\n\n

2000-10-17 11:19\n
  hi\n
  thanks for the reply\n
  could you please give me a quick call? please?\n
  rudy\n
  416 864 8268

This time a fairly quick response:

\n\n\n

2000-10-17 12:05\n
  Hello,\n
  Please call 1-800-xxx-xxxx for assistance.\n
  thank you\n
  webmaster@foobar.ca

Getting warm, eh? I thought so too.

\n\n\n

2000-10-17 13:43\n
  hi \n
  i tried that number but all i got was a generic recording\n
  there was no option like "press 4 to speak to the webmaster"\n
  i want to actually discuss the javascript with you\n
  do you have a problem with discussing the javascript with me?\n
  i won't bite, honest\n
  i would like to help you fix it\n
  i think telling a client to upgrade their browser version is, um, very lame to say the least, but i also understand that perhaps you do not have the authority or autonomy to discuss this with me\n
  if you do not wish to discuss it, could you please pass me to one of your superiors?\n
  thanks\n
  rudy

\n

Now the kicker --

\n
\n\n\n

2000-10-17 14:33\n
  Hello,\n
  I've forwarded this to our technical experts. I am not authorized to\n call customers.\n
  regards,\n
  webmaster@foobar.ca

\n

Is that a riot, or what?! The person who \nresponds to the emails from the Web site is not authorized to \nactually speak to the customers? Time to send them over to\ncluetrain.com.\nThey just don't get it.

\n

I have still not heard back from them, but it's only been a week.

\n
